page.title: 01The area SE of Gainsborough.
page.content: This area of land is predominantly agricultural.The agriculture is dominated by the production of cereal crops although some dairy herds,and to a lesser extent,flocks of sheep,can still be found. Farming is a large scale operation and most farms have amalgamated as they have been purchased by commercial orginisations. The area consists of four small villages;very little industry;one primary school(the others having closed);one garage;narrow roads(some dating back to{Roman}times);large fields devoted to the production of cereal crops;a flat sometimes gently rolling landscape;few shops;a lack of hedges;large isolated farm houses;well visited public houses;many bungalows;little public transport.
